snippet: For decades, national sororities have banned alcohol, but amid debate over how to address sexual assaults, many of them at fraternity parties, female students are questioning that policy.
abstract: Some female college students are questioning decades-old bans on alcohol at sorority houses, as higher education grapples with wave of sexual assault allegations; argue that bans makes women socially dependent on fraternity house parties, where some evidence suggests assaults are far more likely to occur; many argue that allowing sororities to throw parties would give women more control over alcohol use and safety.
lead_paragraph: For decades, national sororities have banned alcohol, but amid debate over how to address sexual assaults, many of them at fraternity parties, female students are questioning that policy.

headline.main: Sorority Anti-Rape Idea: Drinking on Own Turf
headline.print_headline: Sorority Anti-Rape Idea: Drinking on Own Turf
